abstract.p: Paris D'Jon, former manager of pop music group 98 Degrees files lawsuit accusing group members of firing him unjustly after he transformed them into pop stars (S)

block.p: A former manager of the pop music quartet 98 Degrees has filed a lawsuit accusing the group of firing him unjustly after he transformed them into pop stars.

The suit, filed in Federal District Court in Manhattan, said the musicians -- Jeff Timmons, Nick Lachey, Drew Lachey and Justin Jeffre -- breached their contract last year when they fired their manager, Paris D'Jon, and his company, Top 40 Entertainment.
A former manager of the pop music quartet 98 Degrees has filed a lawsuit accusing the group of firing him unjustly after he transformed them into pop stars.

The suit, filed in Federal District Court in Manhattan, said the musicians -- Jeff Timmons, Nick Lachey, Drew Lachey and Justin Jeffre -- breached their contract last year when they fired their manager, Paris D'Jon, and his company, Top 40 Entertainment.

But John J. Rosenberg, a lawyer for the musicians, said the group had adequate grounds to fire Mr. D'Jon and the management company He added that he planned to file a counter suit showing that the group's success had been ''achieved despite and not because of the efforts'' of Mr. D'Jon and Top 40.
